intro: Catophractes alexandri, commonly known as the Alexandrian catophract, is a rare flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss. The flowers, which bloom in shades of yellow and white, attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
